attributes.description: Maximum allowable response time for threat detection.
attributes.name: responseTime

attributes.description: Operational temperature range for system functionality.
attributes.name: operatingTemperatureRange

attributes.description: System redundancy to ensure functionality under adverse conditions.
attributes.name: redundancyLevel

designScenario.description: The Protection System is designed to enhance passenger and crew safety by detecting and managing potential threats in sensitive areas inside and outside the aircraft in real time.
designScenario.name: Protection System

details.description: Monitor the surroundings of the aircraft for potential threats during operations.
Alert crew and activate countermeasures upon detecting unauthorized access near sensitive areas.
Identify threats and respond within 2 seconds of detection.
Maintain high detection accuracy under varying environmental conditions.
Maintain operation under the loss of one sensor or control unit.
Prevent unauthorized tampering with system components.
Interface with existing avionics systems for data sharing.
Enable maintainability through diagnostics and component replacement.

relationships.description: The Sensor Array provides data to the Central Processing Unit for analysis.
The Control Unit depends on the Central Processing Unit for threat assessment data.
The Redundant Power Module is composed of multiple Power Units to ensure uninterrupted operation.

systemComponents.description: Processes inputs and coordinates responses to detected threats.
systemComponents.name: Central Processing Unit

subComponents.description: Controls data flow and response algorithms.
subComponents.name: Main Processor

systemComponents.description: Detects unauthorized activities or access near the aircraft.
systemComponents.name: Sensor Array

subComponents.description: Monitors for motion around the aircraft.
subComponents.name: Motion Sensor

subComponents.description: Detects pressure changes indicative of unauthorized access.
subComponents.name: Pressure Sensor

systemComponents.description: Executes countermeasures and provides alerts based on threat assessments.
systemComponents.name: Control Unit

subComponents.description: Manages activation of external deterrent mechanisms.
subComponents.name: Countermeasure Deployer

systemComponents.description: Ensures continued operation despite primary power loss.
systemComponents.name: Redundant Power Module

comments.body: The Protection System includes subsystems for electrical safeguards in aerospace applications.

rag_context: The Protection System includes the Circuit Protection Unit and the Surge Protector. The Circuit Protection Unit is designed to safeguard aircraft electrical systems by providing fault detection, current interruption, surge protection, and isolation of faulty circuits. It must detect overcurrent and short-circuit conditions, isolate affected circuits, activate protective mechanisms within 10ms of fault detection, and comply with aviation safety standards. The Surge Protector is engineered to detect and mitigate transient overvoltage events rapidly, ensuring protection of sensitive avionics and power distribution circuits. It must detect transient overvoltage events, achieve surge clamping within 5ms, incorporate redundant protection features, and meet safety standards. Both systems are critical components within the aircraft's electrical system, designed for high performance under transient conditions and enhanced safety measures.
